GUILT TRIP
By Yehuda Berg

Nobody’s perfect.

On this spiritual path, we try to be better versions of ourselves every day, but all of us have moments where we fall and find ourselves right back in old destructive patterns.

The secret is that it’s not about how many times we fall. It’s about how many times we get up.

If we live by the spiritual truth that everything in our lives is from the Creator, this includes our failures. Even in those instances where we behave less than admirably, there is Light waiting to be revealed and lessons to be learned.

The problem is that when we fall, it’s easier for us to get wrapped up in feelings of shame and remorse than it is to learn the lesson. The Opponent loves to send us on a guilt trip, taking us a far distance from the Light.

If this sounds like a familiar pattern to you, you’re not alone. This is a story that has been told since the beginning of time. The sin of Adam wasn’t that he ate from the tree of knowledge. The very nature of the Creator is mercy, unconditional love and forgiveness. God forgave Adam, but it was his guilt that disconnected him from the Garden of Eden. Still today, it is the barrier that keeps us from the Creator with every mistake we make.

This is why the Rav often taught, “Where guilt exists, the Light cannot dwell.”

It’s important to remember when we slide back, it is because the Creator is trying to move us forward. Guilt prevents us from that forward movement. It keeps us stuck in the past.

It’s okay to fall. In fact, it’s part of the process!
